translation: obfitować [to exist in large numbers]
sentence: Theories abound about how the universe began.

translation: z otwartymi ustami [with the mouth open, especially showing surprise or shock]
sentence: We watched, our mouths agape in excitement.

translation: przydział [the process of sharing something, or the amount that you get]
sentence: The trade body labeled as illegal last year's allotment of $3.2 billion in cotton subsidies.

translation: absolwenci [the former male and female students of a school, college, or university]
sentence: Four alumni of an elementary school are having a reunion in a coffee shop.

translation: przystępny [friendly and easy to talk to]
sentence: Despite being a big star, she's very approachable.

translation: napastnik [formal; a person who attacks another person]
sentence: Can you describe your assailant?

translation: wytrwały, dbały [formal; showing hard work, care, and attention to detail]
sentence: The government has been assiduous in the fight against inflation.

translation: krzywe [(of legs) bending out at the knees]
sentence: She had bent, slightly bandy legs.

translation: pozbawiony, opuszczony [formal; not having something or feeling great loss]
sentence: Alone now and almost penniless, he was bereft of hope.

translation: nękać [hurt or troubled by something bad]
sentence: Many problems have beset the team in recent months.

translation: sprzeczać się [to argue about things that are not important]
sentence: The children are always bickering about something or another.

translation: wietrzny, przenikliwy (wiatr) [with strong winds]
sentence: The day was cold and blustery.

translation: szczerze
sentence: He candidly admitted that he was surprised and disappointed.

translation: kłótliwy, przykry w usposobieniu [arguing and complaining a lot]
sentence: He's getting a bit cantankerous in his old age.

translation: zastrzeżenie, klauzula [a warning to consider something before taking any more action, or a statement that limits a more general statement]
sentence: Any discussion of legal action must be preceded by a caveat about fees.

translation: otwór, pusta przestrzeń, ubytek [a hole, or an empty space between two surfaces; a hole in a tooth]
sentence: The gold was hidden in a secret cavity.

translation: hołubić, pielęgnować, cenić [to love, protect, and care for someone or something that is important to you]
sentence: Although I cherish my children, I do allow them their independence.

translation: koedukacyjny [for male and female students together]
sentence: The softball team is coed.

translation: składać się, zawierać, stanowić [formal; to have things or people as parts or members; to consist of]
sentence: The course comprises a class book, a practice book, and a CD.

translation: sprzyjający [providing the right conditions for something good to happen or exist]
sentence: A quiet room is a more conducive atmosphere for studying.

translation: skrzypieć, zaskrzypieć [to make the sound that a door sometimes makes when you open it or that a wooden floor sometimes makes when you step on it]
sentence: I heard the floorboards creak as he crept closer.

translation: zwodniczy [making you believe something that is not true]
sentence: It's deceptive - from the outside the building looks small, but inside it's very big.

translation: wprawny, zręczny
sentence: He finished off the painting with a few deft strokes of the brush.

translation: rozbroić, rozładować
sentence: Bomb disposal experts have defused a 110-pound bomb at a subway station this afternoon.

translation: zrozpaczony [showing or feeling the loss of all hope]
sentence: With every day that passed he became more despairing.

translation: rozwiązać grupę [(of a group) to stop existing, or to cause a group to stop existing]
sentence: She formed a political group which disbanded a year later.

translation: łania [the female of animals such as the deer or rabbit]
sentence: The doe is of a light fawn color and has no horns.

translation: wdowa [a woman of high social rank whose husband is dead but who has a title and property because of her marriage to him]
sentence: This movement had been greatly assisted by Margaret, duchess dowager.

translation: uciskany, poniewierany [treated badly and unfairly]
sentence: It was a downtrodden nation during centuries of foreign occupation.

translation: rażący [extremely bad in a way that is very noticeable]
sentence: It was an egregious error for a statesman to show such ignorance.

translation: oczarować, zafascynować [to keep someone completely interested]
sentence: They listened enthralled to what he was saying.

translation: szczególny, specjalny [formal]
sentence: Namely, it is the argument that has been updated towards the end of the previous paragraph which needs especial care.

translation: owca [a female sheep, especially an adult one]
sentence: The 60 ewes were allocated to the 6 experimental groups as follows.

translation: fragment, wyrywek [a short part taken from a speech, book, film, etc.]
sentence: An excerpt from her new thriller will appear in this weekend's magazine.

translation: wycieczka
sentence: We've booked to go on an excursion to Pompeii.

translation: waśń [an argument that has existed for a long time between two people or groups, causing a lot of anger or violence]
sentence: The mayor has a longstanding feud with the media.

translation: precyzyjny, skomplikowany [informal; difficult to do because the parts involved are small]
sentence: Repairing a watch is a very fiddly job.

translation: ognisty, płomienny [showing strong emotion, especially anger; bright or burning like a fire]
sentence: He’s known for his fiery temper.

translation: gazowany [having a lot of bubbles]
sentence: The wine was pink and slightly fizzy.

translation: prosperować, kwitnąć
sentence: My tomatoes are flourishing this summer - it must be the warm weather.

translation: oszalały [uncontrolled and excited, sometimes violent]
sentence: As the evening wore on the dancing got more and more frenzied.

translation: czelność
sentence: Then they had the gall to complain!

translation: gapić się [informal; to look at something or someone in a stupid or rude way]
sentence: Don't sit there gawking like that - give me a hand!

translation: galaretowaty
sentence: The liquid solidifies into a gelatinous mass.

translation: upiorny
sentence: She woke up in the middle of a ghastly nightmare.

translation: wąwóz [a narrow and usually steep valley]
sentence: The only way to cross the gorge was over a flimsy wooden bridge.

translation: zgrzytliwy
sentence: The sound of his grating voice complaining all day was driving me crazy.

translation: zrzędliwy [informal]
sentence: Don't be so grouchy!

translation: schronienie, przystań [a safe or peaceful place; an area of water next to the coast where ships and boats can shelter, or a small port]
sentence: They wanted to provide safe havens for the refugees.

translation: gorączkowy, szaleńczy [full of activity, or very busy and fast]
sentence: The area has become a haven for people tired of the hectic pace of city life.

translation: podróżować autostopem [to travel by getting free rides in someone else's vehicle]
sentence: They hitchhiked to Paris.

translation: gromadzić
sentence: During the siege people began hoarding food and supplies.

translation: ochrypły
sentence: You'll make yourself hoarse if you keep shouting like that!

translation: nienamacalny [difficult to feel or understand]
sentence: While you can view the signs of love, you can't touch love because it's impalpable.

translation: uwięzić [to put or keep someone in prison or in a place used as a prison]
sentence: Thousands of dissidents have been interrogated or incarcerated.

translation: spalić, spopielić [to burn something completely]
sentence: The spacecraft and its crew were incinerated by the billion-degree temperatures generated by the fireball.

translation: rodzimy, rdzenny [having always lived or existed in a place]
sentence: Are there any species of frog indigenous to the area?

translation: pomysłowy
sentence: She's very ingenious when it comes to finding excuses.

translation: zrozumiałość [(of speech and writing) the quality of being possible to understand]
sentence: Foreign accented speech may affect intelligibility.

translation: pobratymiec [old use; a man who belongs to the same family as someone else]
sentence: In 1320 Robert summoned his kinsman Philip V.

translation: kradzież [stealing, especially (in the US) the crime of taking something that does not belong to you, without illegally entering a building to do so]
sentence: The couple were charged with larceny.

translation: skowronek
sentence: The lark tunes his songs.

translation: dziewczyna [mainly Scottish English or Northern English; a girl or young woman]
sentence: The lass could afford so little food that she fainted twice at work.

translation: frywolność (lub lekkomyślność) [formal; humor or lack of seriousness, especially during a serious occasion]
sentence: The joke provided a moment of levity in an otherwise dreary meeting.

translation: współpraca [communication between people or groups that work with each other; też: pozamałżeńskie kontakty seksualne]
sentence: We work in close liaison with the police.

translation: niedorzeczny, śmieszny [stupid or unreasonable and deserving to be laughed at]
sentence: He looked ludicrous in that suit!

translation: upoważniać
sentence: The law mandates that imported goods be identified as such.

translation: potulny, cichy [quiet, gentle, and not willing to argue or express your opinions in a forceful way]
sentence: She seemed so very meek and mild.

translation: zapał, odwaga [ability and determination when competing or doing something difficult]
sentence: The real test of her political mettle came in the May elections.

translation: umiar [the quality of doing something within reasonable limits]
sentence: You can eat whatever you want as long as it's in moderation.

translation: węzeł
sentence: A network is a series of points or nodes interconnected by communication paths.

translation: maść [a smooth, thick substance that is used on painful or damaged skin]
sentence: Wounds were closed and treated with antibiotic ointment.

translation: zawzięty, uparty, zadufany [having very strong opinions that you are not willing to change]
sentence: I've never met anyone so arrogant and opinionated.

translation: przeprawa, gehenna, ciężka próba [a very unpleasant and painful or difficult experience]
sentence: The hostages' ordeal came to an end when soldiers stormed the building.

translation: otwarty, szczery [expressing strong opinions very directly without worrying if other people are offended]
sentence: Mr Masack is an outspoken critic of the present government.

translation: smoła
sentence: Pitch is a black sticky substance made from oil or coal, used on roofs or the wooden boards of a ship to stop water from coming through.

translation: opanowany
sentence: She was a very placid (= calm and not easily excited) child who slept all night and hardly ever cried.

translation: porowaty
sentence: Effects of salt concentration changes during freezing on the unfrozen water content of porous materials.

translation: pośmiertny [happening after a person's death]
sentence: Posthumous reputations are subject to the vagaries of history.

translation: niepewny, ryzykowny [in a dangerous state because of not being safe or not being held in place firmly]
sentence: The lorry was lodged in a very precarious way, with its front wheels hanging over the cliff.

translation: trudna sytuacja, kłopot [an unpleasant situation that is difficult to get out of]
sentence: I'm in a bit of a predicament because I've accidentally accepted two invitations to dinner on the same night.

translation: geniusz [a young person who is very good at something]
sentence: The 16-year-old tennis prodigy is the youngest player ever to reach the Olympic finals.

translation: rzekomy [that has been stated to be true or to have happened, although this may not be the case]
sentence: A recent study into the purported health benefits of the drink was not conclusive.

translation: blask, promienność [happiness, beauty, or good health that you can see in someone's face]
sentence: He was struck by the radiance of her smile.

translation: racja bytu, logika [the reasons or intentions that cause a particular set of beliefs or actions]
sentence: I don't understand the rationale for these restrictions.

translation: odstraszać, odpychać [to force someone or something to stop moving towards you or attacking you; (of a material) to not allow a substance to be absorbed into it]
sentence: It is not true that eating garlic repels mosquitoes.

translation: wytchnienie [formal]
sentence: The weekend was a brief respite from the pressures of work.

translation: pobocze
sentence: Children were selling cold drinks by the roadside.

translation: uczenie się na pamięć [learning something in order to be able to repeat it from memory, rather than in order to understand it]
sentence: She learned multiplication by rote.

translation: świerzb
sentence: Scabies is a skin disease that causes itching and small, red, raised spots.

translation: błyszczący, błyskotliwy [funny, exciting, and clever]
sentence: It was a superb script and a scintillating production.

translation: przepyszny [informal]
sentence: There 's always a good choice for vegetarians, along with some scrumptious desserts.

translation: zdziecinniały, zniedołężniały [showing poor mental ability because of old age, especially being unable to think clearly and make decisions]
sentence: He spent many years caring for his senile mother.

translation: spokojny [peaceful and calm; worried by nothing]
sentence: The hotel offers a haven of peace and serenity away from the bustle of the city.

translation: całun [a cloth used to cover the body of a dead person]
sentence: Everything was covered in a thick shroud of dust.

translation: kalać [formal; to spoil something that is pure or someone's perfect reputation]
sentence: His reputation, he said, had been unfairly sullied by half-truths and innuendos.

translation: nurkować, przeprowadzać nalot [to move very quickly and easily through the air, especially down from a high position in order to attack; to make a sudden attack on a place or group of people in order to surround and catch them]
sentence: The eagle swooped down to snatch a young rabbit.

translation: horrendalny [formal; so bad, immoral, etc. that it should make you feel ashamed]
sentence: To make people feel shame or guilt for being ill is unconscionable.

translation: para [gas or extremely small drops of liquid that result from the heating of a liquid or solid]
sentence: The hollow glass tank contains hot mercury vapor.

translation: kratka wentylacyjna
sentence: If you have a gas fire in a room, you should have some kind of outside vent.

translation: szkodniki, robactwo [small animals and insects that can be harmful and are difficult to control when they appear in large numbers]
sentence: Flies, lice, and cockroaches can all be described as vermin.

translation: stawiać zakład [to risk money by guessing the result of something]
sentence: He is so confident of victory he has wagered on himself.

translation: bezmyślny [(of something bad, such as damage, cruelty, waste) extreme and showing no care at all]
sentence: He displayed a wanton disregard for the facts.

translation: dowcipny [using words in an amusing and intelligent way]
sentence: I think she’s one of the wittiest comics on television.

translation: chwiejny
sentence: I've been in bed with flu and my legs still feel a little wobbly.
